channel.title: Comments on: Useful new preference in DDE 8.5.2 for Java Agents

item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>@Lars,</p><p>That's just the default settings. It was turned on almost immeditately after I took that screenshot!</p><p>Matt</p>
item.content:encoded:
@Lars,

That's just the default settings. It was turned on almost immeditately after I took that screenshot!

Matt

item.title: By: Lars Berntrop-Bos
item.dc:creator: Lars Berntrop-Bos
item.description: <p>Why do you have the refactoring preference turned off?</p>
item.content:encoded: Why do you have the refactoring preference turned off?

item.title: By: Steven Newton
item.dc:creator: Steven Newton
item.description: <p>Are you or anyone else finding problems with this option.</p><p>I have found in particular when saving script libs that sometimes (cant identify any pattern) that although the source is saved the Java class files dont get recompiled (i.e. the old code is still the code that executes even though the source has changed.)</p>
item.content:encoded:
Are you or anyone else finding problems with this option.

I have found in particular when saving script libs that sometimes (cant identify any pattern) that although the source is saved the Java class files dont get recompiled (i.e. the old code is still the code that executes even though the source has changed.)

item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>My understanding of it is that every time the agent is saved the entire set of classes is recompiled, so if it's a big agent then it could, in theory, take a while to save. But I personally agree with you that this is how it should have worked all along.</p>
item.content:encoded: My understanding of it is that every time the agent is saved the entire set of classes is recompiled, so if it's a big agent then it could, in theory, take a while to save. But I personally agree with you that this is how it should have worked all along.

item.title: By: Craig Schumann
item.dc:creator: Craig Schumann
item.description: <p>Why is that a preference? Shouldn't that just be the way it works? What other side effect are we agreeing to be burnt by when ticking the box?</p>
item.content:encoded: Why is that a preference? Shouldn't that just be the way it works? What other side effect are we agreeing to be burnt by when ticking the box?

item.title: By: Sreedhar Reddy
item.dc:creator: Sreedhar Reddy
item.description: <p>Hi Matt White,</p><p>Thank you for the nice tip. </p><p>thanks,<br/>Sreedhar.</p>
item.content:encoded:
Hi Matt White,

Thank you for the nice tip.

thanks,
Sreedhar.
